trans-unit.source: layout: page title: "e10s and Featured Add-ons" permalink: /e10s-addons/ lang: en ref: e10s-addons parent: activities
trans-unit.target: layout: page title: "e10s and Featured Add-ons" permalink: /e10s-addons/ lang: ar ref: e10s-addons parent: activities

trans-unit.source: redirect_from: "/experiments/e10s-addons/"
trans-unit.target: redirect_from: "/experiments/e10s-addons/"

trans-unit.source: TOC
trans-unit.target: TOC

trans-unit.source: {:toc}
trans-unit.target: {:toc}

trans-unit.source: Featured add-ons receive enhanced promotion on AMO, which results in greatly increased installs for this recommended content.
trans-unit.target: Featured add-ons receive enhanced promotion on AMO, which results in greatly increased installs for this recommended content.

trans-unit.source: With the emergence of multiprocess Firefox (e10s), we need to ensure these spotlighted add-ons meet the highest levels of browser compatibility and functionality.
trans-unit.target: With the emergence of multiprocess Firefox (e10s), we need to ensure these spotlighted add-ons meet the highest levels of browser compatibility and functionality.

trans-unit.source: __NOTE: This activity is running only until November 4th, 2016__.
trans-unit.target: __NOTE: This activity is running only until November 4th, 2016__.

trans-unit.source: Impact and Metrics
trans-unit.target: Impact and Metrics

trans-unit.source: Millions of Firefox users have installed add-ons directly from the [Featured Add-ons collection](https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/extensions/?sort=featured).
trans-unit.target: Millions of Firefox users have installed add-ons directly from the [Featured Add-ons collection](https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/extensions/?sort=featured).

trans-unit.source: They expect and trust Mozilla to guide them to the very best add-ons content.
trans-unit.target: They expect and trust Mozilla to guide them to the very best add-ons content.

trans-unit.source: Ensuring compatibility with the latest browser technology, in this case e10s—which will be turned on for Firefox with Firefox 50 (November 8) who have compatible add-ons—is critical to the claim that these featured add-ons deserve their attention.
trans-unit.target: Ensuring compatibility with the latest browser technology, in this case e10s—which will be turned on for Firefox with Firefox 50 (November 8) who have compatible add-ons—is critical to the claim that these featured add-ons deserve their attention.

trans-unit.source: Goals for this area
trans-unit.target: Goals for this area

trans-unit.source: __Impact:__
trans-unit.target: __Impact:__

trans-unit.source: 55 featured add-ons, with <100k users, are tested
trans-unit.target: 55 featured add-ons, with <100k users, are tested

trans-unit.source: 400 individual add-on tests
trans-unit.target: 400 individual add-on tests

trans-unit.source: __Strength:__
trans-unit.target: __Strength:__

trans-unit.source: 15 Mobilizers activated
trans-unit.target: 15 Mobilizers activated

trans-unit.source: 200 add-on testers at events
trans-unit.target: 200 add-on testers at events

trans-unit.source: Audience for this activity
trans-unit.target: Audience for this activity

trans-unit.source: This is for participants with an interest or passion for add-ons content from a user experience perspective.
trans-unit.target: This is for participants with an interest or passion for add-ons content from a user experience perspective.

trans-unit.source: You do not need any particular technical skills, but rather an ability to install add-ons and test their features to ensure the content works as expected with multiprocess Firefox.
trans-unit.target: You do not need any particular technical skills, but rather an ability to install add-ons and test their features to ensure the content works as expected with multiprocess Firefox.

trans-unit.source: Activity Format
trans-unit.target: Activity Format

trans-unit.source: While this activity can be run solo, we encourage you to run an event in your community to get together people who care about the Web.
trans-unit.target: While this activity can be run solo, we encourage you to run an event in your community to get together people who care about the Web.

trans-unit.source: The goal is to test sites, diagnose problems, and discuss how to evangelise locally to developers about a Web that works for everyone.
trans-unit.target: The goal is to test sites, diagnose problems, and discuss how to evangelise locally to developers about a Web that works for everyone.

trans-unit.source: Put an event team together
trans-unit.target: Put an event team together

trans-unit.source: Choose a date and secure a venue
trans-unit.target: Choose a date and secure a venue

trans-unit.source: Setup the event on Reps Portal ([instructions](https://wiki.mozilla.org/ReMo/SOPs/Event_hosting)).
trans-unit.target: Setup the event on Reps Portal ([instructions](https://wiki.mozilla.org/ReMo/SOPs/Event_hosting)).

trans-unit.source: [Find a Rep](https://reps.mozilla.org/people/) closeby to do this if you are not one.
trans-unit.target: [Find a Rep](https://reps.mozilla.org/people/) closeby to do this if you are not one.

trans-unit.source: For duration, we recommend 2-3 hours with 10-15 attendees.
trans-unit.target: For duration, we recommend 2-3 hours with 10-15 attendees.

trans-unit.source: Event Flow
trans-unit.target: Event Flow

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Give a quick introduction to attendees about what we are doing and why it is important.
trans-unit.target: Give a quick introduction to attendees about what we are doing and why it is important.

trans-unit.source: The main point is that with more compatible add-ons, e10s will roll out faster to potentially millions more Firefox users.
trans-unit.target: The main point is that with more compatible add-ons, e10s will roll out faster to potentially millions more Firefox users.

trans-unit.source: Ask attendees to tweet about their attendance.
trans-unit.target: Ask attendees to tweet about their attendance.

trans-unit.source: Here is a suggested message:
trans-unit.target: Here is a suggested message:

trans-unit.source: I’m helping more @Firefox add-ons to become compatible with new cutting edge technology <link of this page> #MozActivate
trans-unit.target: I’m helping more @Firefox add-ons to become compatible with new cutting edge technology <link of this page> #MozActivate

trans-unit.source: Steps to test...
trans-unit.target: Steps to test...

trans-unit.source: All test reporting takes place on the [Featured Add-ons Compatibility Test page](https://featured-addons-test.herokuapp.com/).
trans-unit.target: All test reporting takes place on the [Featured Add-ons Compatibility Test page](https://featured-addons-test.herokuapp.com/).

trans-unit.source: You should see a link to an add-on near the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: You should see a link to an add-on near the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: To make sure multiprocess Firefox is enabled, you'll need to use [Firefox 50 (Beta)](https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/channel/) when testing an add-on.
trans-unit.target: To make sure multiprocess Firefox is enabled, you'll need to use [Firefox 50 (Beta)](https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/channel/) when testing an add-on.

trans-unit.source: For every add-on you want to test, you’ll need to do the following:
trans-unit.target: For every add-on you want to test, you’ll need to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Firefox profile by going to __about:profiles__ => “Create new profile”.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Firefox profile by going to __about:profiles__ => “Create new profile”.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name and click “Done”.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name and click “Done”.

trans-unit.source: Then click “Launch profile in new browser” to launch it.
trans-unit.target: Then click “Launch profile in new browser” to launch it.

trans-unit.source: Install the ["Add-on Compatibility Reporter"](https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/add-on-compatibility-reporter?src=external-activatee10s1) (ACR) add-on in the new profile.
trans-unit.target: Install the ["Add-on Compatibility Reporter"](https://addons.mozilla.org/addon/add-on-compatibility-reporter?src=external-activatee10s1) (ACR) add-on in the new profile.

trans-unit.source: Install the add-on you want to test in the new profile.
trans-unit.target: Install the add-on you want to test in the new profile.

trans-unit.source: Go to __about:addons__ and make sure that it says “Multiprocess is enabled” in the top right corner and “Compatible to multiprocess” for the add-on you are testing.
trans-unit.target: Go to __about:addons__ and make sure that it says “Multiprocess is enabled” in the top right corner and “Compatible to multiprocess” for the add-on you are testing.

trans-unit.source: Test the main functionality of the add-on.
trans-unit.target: Test the main functionality of the add-on.

trans-unit.source: Does it perform as expected?
trans-unit.target: Does it perform as expected?

trans-unit.source: (Testing typically takes 15 - 30 minutes)
trans-unit.target: (Testing typically takes 15 - 30 minutes)

trans-unit.source: Once testing is complete, go back to the Featured Add-on Test page in your main profile and select YES or NO to reflect its test results, then click “Submit”.
trans-unit.target: Once testing is complete, go back to the Featured Add-on Test page in your main profile and select YES or NO to reflect its test results, then click “Submit”.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to leave comments (optional) if you care to detail issues you may have encountered.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to leave comments (optional) if you care to detail issues you may have encountered.

trans-unit.source: Clicking Submit will also refresh the page, and serve up a new add-on to test.
trans-unit.target: Clicking Submit will also refresh the page, and serve up a new add-on to test.

trans-unit.source: Test as many as you like!
trans-unit.target: Test as many as you like!

trans-unit.source: Output
trans-unit.target: Output

trans-unit.source: Additional to the recommended event flow here are some things we’d like you, the event organizer, to do.
trans-unit.target: Additional to the recommended event flow here are some things we’d like you, the event organizer, to do.

trans-unit.source: Fill out the post-event metrics on the event page you setup on the Reps portal
trans-unit.target: Fill out the post-event metrics on the event page you setup on the Reps portal

trans-unit.source: Tell us about your event.
trans-unit.target: Tell us about your event.

trans-unit.source: This can be before and after.
trans-unit.target: This can be before and after.

trans-unit.source: We love to hear about upcoming plans, and of course love to hear about what was achieved at the event with a picture or two!
trans-unit.target: We love to hear about upcoming plans, and of course love to hear about what was achieved at the event with a picture or two!

trans-unit.source: [Here is the Discourse post to write to](https://discourse.mozilla-community.org/t/activate-mozilla-e10s-compatibility-and-featured-add-ons/11193)
trans-unit.target: [Here is the Discourse post to write to](https://discourse.mozilla-community.org/t/activate-mozilla-e10s-compatibility-and-featured-add-ons/11193)

trans-unit.source: Extra
trans-unit.target: Extra

trans-unit.source: If you’re interested in add-ons and want to learn more about ways you can get involved with addons.mozilla.org, please visit: [https://wiki.mozilla.org/Add-ons/Contribute)
trans-unit.target: If you’re interested in add-ons and want to learn more about ways you can get involved with addons.mozilla.org, please visit: [https://wiki.mozilla.org/Add-ons/Contribute)
